channel.title: @mitb
channel.description:
alpha is up and running nicely.
what's actually left to do
Client - hows this coming along with the torrent stuff? SQL - our loginservers loading/saving, is that all working? Joe0 or CFF changed things around and i'm unsure if SQL loading/saving is working smoothly Host - whos hosting the main game? are you buying a dedicated server? what OS? etc etc.
need answers!

item.title: @mitb

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:46, topic:428515”]Then why work on a 201? Why ever go backwards?[/quote]There isn’t any visible changes whatsoever besides some login id changes apparently.

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

I managed to modify the client to load landscape from land/maps63.jag/mem files. It still uses the sector system so it should work on the server as well.
So how about it? Shall we start using the 201 client?
There are still some bugs of course, e.g. the server sending a sprite request for “hatchet” when the client doesn’t even know what the fuck it is :o

Read full topic

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:31, topic:428515”]edit: Remember that there is no real significance between like 198-204 versions of the client, only changes are in the packet ids and something related to banking if I’m remembering right[/quote]Nice. This sounds like the best idea at the moment. Good work.

Read full topic

Question; Did reines modify the packets in client somehow?
[/quote]Uhh I think he only removed the packet rotation

I don’t mean to sound ignorant, but what exactly is packet rotation?
[/quote]The opcodes change.[/quote]
Ah I thought it means something like that.

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:31, topic:428515”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=531207.msg3883421#msg3883421 date=1326238265]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=531207.msg3883365#msg3883365 date=1326233891]

CodeForFame stated earlier in IRC that he could set up the latest client with the server.

Can he get me a copy of the latest client then?
[/quote]I was going to use instrumentation to alter the IP it connects to, and make the server work with it. Apparently, it has opcode rotation, so it would be a fair amount of work.
[/quote]I’m currently refactoring (using RSCD & and some project of eXemplar’s as a reference) and modifying a fresh 201 deob by SeanWT (had to use my google-fu a bit to find it) from 2004. I already changed the data encryption when logging in to work with the MoparClassic server, all that needs to be done is to change the packet ids, and how some of the packets are read or sent (eg. npc and player update packets, sleep equation, etc).

GitHub

xetr0v/mpc-client

Contribute to mpc-client development by creating an account on GitHub.

edit: Remember that there is no real significance between like 198-204 versions of the client, only changes are in the packet ids and something related to banking if I’m remembering right[/quote]
Question; Did reines modify the packets in client somehow?

Read full topic

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:30, topic:428515”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=531207.msg3883365#msg3883365 date=1326233891]

CodeForFame stated earlier in IRC that he could set up the latest client with the server.

Can he get me a copy of the latest client then?
[/quote]I was going to use instrumentation to alter the IP it connects to, and make the server work with it. Apparently, it has opcode rotation, so it would be a fair amount of work.[/quote]I’m currently refactoring (using RSCD & and some project of eXemplar’s as a reference) and modifying a fresh 201 deob by SeanWT (had to use my google-fu a bit to find it) from 2004. I already changed the data encryption when logging in to work with the MoparClassic server, all that needs to be done is to change the packet ids, and how some of the packets are read or sent (eg. npc and player update packets, sleep equation, etc).

GitHub

xetr0v/mpc-client

Contribute to mpc-client development by creating an account on GitHub.

edit: Remember that there is no real significance between like 198-204 versions of the client, only changes are in the packet ids and something related to banking if I’m remembering right

Read full topic

[/quote]

Can he get me a copy of the latest client then?[/quote]I was going to use instrumentation to alter the IP it connects to, and make the server work with it. Apparently, it has opcode rotation, so it would be a fair amount of work.

item.description:
@The_Djinn wrote:

Moparisthebest:

But aren’t there a lot of bugs in CodeForFame’s version that need fixed? It would probably be easier to just start with a clean non-edited version.

I’m not sure, I haven’t checked the Client. I’d wait for CodeForFame to answer that, or someone who knows the RSC Client a lot more.

Read full topic

item.title: @mitb
item.dc:creator: @The_Djinn The Djinn
item.description:
@The_Djinn wrote:

Moparisthebest:

So which version and should I use CodeForFame’s version, or start with a clean one?

I think we should stick with the same version and just add the features in. Which will most likely be quicker and easier to do. Unless if someone wants to go through and do everything with the new client.

Read full topic
